image.altText: A graphic showing a row of chairs and signage that says 'Medicare' and 'bulk billing availabel'

props.synopsis: Two new surveys have cast doubt on whether the signature health policy of this election campaign can be delivered.

title.children: 'Every month it's a battle': GPs say they won't switch to full bulk-billing

image.altText: A close up of Peter Dutton on the campaign trail.

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton denies changing his position on a popular tax break for people who buy an electric vehicle. Follow live.

title.children: Dutton insists there's been no EV policy reversal

image.altText: Damen Changde tug

props.synopsis: A new fleet of tug boats that the Defence Department ordered for the Royal Australian Navy has been secretly built at a Chinese shipyard under a $28 million contract awarded last year to a Dutch company.

title.children: Australian navy's newest boats made in China

image.altText: 2025-02-28T182007Z_1921454418_RC2T3DACDYHS_RTRMADP_3_UKRAINE-CRISIS-USA

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine is "very close" but criticises Kyiv for refusing to recognise Crimea as Russian territory.

title.children: Trump says he thinks he has deal with Zelenskyy and Putin to end war

image.altText: a male politician wearing a suit speaking at lectern in front of party members

props.synopsis: The opposition leader is being cautious with his language as he doesn't want to turn off Chinese-Australian voters, as the Coalition did last election, but he also doesn't want to upset those on his right flank.

title.children: The Coalition's defence promise is driven by both China and Trump

image.altText: A man in religious garb sitting in front of a red curtain, looking on

props.synopsis: As he glided around St Peter's Square in his popemobile on Sunday, the fact he was 88 and had just spent several weeks in hospital somehow seemed a distant memory. Then everything changed.

title.children: Pope Francis's final hours: A simple dinner and a meeting with an adversary

image.altText: close up of donald trump as he pouts his lips and raises his eyebrows

props.synopsis: He added that he expects to strike a deal and set the final tariff figure on China over the next two or three weeks.

title.children: Trump says China tariff cuts depend on Beijing's actions

image.altText: An older man stands in front of rows of wine in a store.

props.synopsis: A teenager who was out on bail has handed himself into police overnight after the owner of a Darwin supermarket was stabbed to death at his shop in Nightcliff on Wednesday afternoon.

title.children: Bailed teen arrested over fatal stabbing of Darwin grocery store owner

image.altText: An older man wearing glasses with grey hair delivering a speech at a conference table, looking stern.

props.synopsis: The President of the Palestinian Authority in the West Bank has demanded the militant group free the remaining 59 Israeli hostages held in Gaza and hand over its weapons.

title.children: 'You sons of dogs': Palestinian leader blasts Hamas in hostage release demand

image.altText: Six soldiers in camouflage holding guns stand in the back of a small car looking out

props.synopsis: The attack is the worst on civilians in the country since the 2008 Mumbai terror attack.

title.children: India downgrades ties with Pakistan after fatal attack on Kashmir tourists

image.altText: A segment of a chart showing the proportion of votes going to the ALP, the LNP and 'Other candidates' at the 2022 election.

props.synopsis: This triangle is going to help us explain how Australian politics has fundamentally changed over the past five decades.

title.children: This triangle helps explain a titanic shift in how Australia votes

image.altText: An image of sandstone buildings against a blue sky

props.synopsis: In New Zealand, there is now a conversation about an organisation called Atlas Network and whether or not it has influenced the right-bloc government's agenda.

title.children: Growing questions in NZ about organisation called Atlas Network

image.altText: Trump gives a quizzical gesture at his desk in  the oval office

props.synopsis: How exactly did some of our workplaces become the target of populist politics — and why is it working in the US while in Australia the Coalition has had to reign in its attacks?

title.children: 'Appeals to a base of white men': Dutton tried Trump's workplace tactics

image.altText: Pope waves from wheelchair in white with red cardinals behind him

props.synopsis: Pope Francis's passing reminds us yet again of the complete absence of women in the upper echelons of the church. This is despite the fact that he did more to elevate women than any other pope.

title.children: Women still locked out of church leadership, despite huge impact on their lives

image.altText: A storm cloud approaching land on an autumn afternoon

props.synopsis: From showers in the east to a chilly dawn service in the west, this is the Anzac Day weather forecast across Australia.

title.children: Parts of Australia's east set to be soaked this Anzac Day

image.altText: Modern Signaller

props.synopsis: They often shy away from the spotlight, but signallers play a crucial role in defending Australia. They'll be recognised for their service by leading Anzac Day marches across the nation.

title.children: The invisible soldiers keeping Australia safe for a century to be recognised

image.altText: A male lion roaring and showing its sharp teeth.

props.synopsis: New research suggests a skeleton which belonged to a gladiator was mauled by a lion or another big cat during combat.

title.children: Bones suggest a lion gnawed on Roman gladiator's body while he died

image.altText: A man's hand writing notes in a notebook in front of ASX boards

props.synopsis: The local share market opens higher as global stocks rally following the US president apparently softening his stance on China and the Federal Reserve. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Global markets, ASX rally on softer Trump stance

image.altText: A man in a navy suit and tie walks next to a silver sign with the number 3 on it

props.synopsis: Former South Australian opposition leader David Speirs has lost a bid to avoid being convicted over drug supply charges.

title.children: Former SA opposition leader David Speirs convicted over drug supply charges

image.altText: Pauline Hanson cocks her head to the side while looking down her nose between the shoulders of two men

props.synopsis: Two of Australia's most striking populist figures are again at odds; this time, over preference deals. Here's how it could influence the election.

title.children: Preference deals could change who wins in some seats

image.altText: Norwegian athlete Henriette Jaeger runs around a bend in a 400m race on an indoor track with a rival behind her.

props.synopsis: Norwegian athletes are advised against eating any kind of meat while in China due to the risk of contamination and failed dope tests ahead of two major events due in the country next month.

title.children: Meat off the menu for Norwegian athletes in China over doping fears

image.altText: a donald trump mask and maga hat

props.synopsis: A costume shop that sold out of Trump-style MAGA hats says they are being worn in a "playful, ironic sense". Others say the red cap means much more.

title.children: Anti-woke or a bit of fun? Where MAGA hats are hot items in Australia

image.altText: An illustration of a giant kangaroo from hundreds of thousands of years ago.

props.synopsis: A new peer-reviewed study has found that, unlike modern kangaroos, the extinct marsupial megafauna Protemnodon were less mobile, which they believe, along with a change in climate, led to their extinction.

title.children: Here's how a change in climate made Australia's giant kangaroos vanish

image.altText: Kyneton Football and Netball Club coach speaking to players.

props.synopsis: The AFL is set to review the circumstances around Kyneton Football Netball Club’s women’s side breaking away from the club, as more women's teams fold across the state.

title.children: Women's footy sides fold amid claims of a lack of support and understanding

image.altText: Harvey Weinstein adjusts his tie as he appears in court in manhattan

props.synopsis: For the first time, prosecutors publicly identified Kaja Sokola and detailed her account of what unfolded between her and the Oscar-winning movie producer in the early 2000s.

title.children: Former model named in Harvey Weinstein's rape retrial

image.altText: Stephen Bates in a cowboy hat.

props.synopsis: Who will finish first of the three candidates in the sunshine state's most anticipated three-cornered contest?

title.children: In Brisbane's three-way contest, who ends up on top?

image.altText: An old oub with vehicles out the front and Pier Hotel signage on the roof.

props.synopsis: An iconic West Australian pub established in the 1890s will be flattened later this month, and BHP's plans for the site have left Port Hedland locals underwhelmed.

title.children: 'Toughest pub in the world' to be demolished to make way for a park

image.altText: police officers tape off a crime scene

props.synopsis: An elderly man is in hospital after being allegedly punched by a teenager outside a polling booth in Sydney's inner west.

title.children: Teen charged for allegedly punching elderly man at Sydney polling booth

image.altText: Liz Bancroft in a hospital bed with her partner

props.synopsis: Liz Bancroft found IVF difficult for many of the reasons you'd expect. But a diagnosis after becoming a mother shed further light on why she found infertility treatment so tough.

title.children: The struggle of IVF when you're neurodivergent

image.altText: Roadwork sign with witches hat and cars in background

props.synopsis: Shire councils urge motorists to adhere to lower speed limits at dangerous roadworks as the national peak body calls for technology companies to get their apps to refer to the people working on the road.

title.children: Calls for navigation apps to refer to people not roadworks

image.altText: A blonde girl and her father stand side by side holding small Styrofoam packs with a deflated weather balloon attached.

props.synopsis: Pete Furphy was surprised to discover remnants of scientific research equipment that had travelled more than 300 kilometres when he and his kids helped clean a secluded south-west Victorian beach.

title.children: Discarded weather balloons wash up on Victorian shores

image.altText: A person crouches holding a turtle up to the camera

props.synopsis: Researchers hope new breeding sites are a positive sign for the endangered species' survival.

title.children: Endangered 'bum-breathing' turtle nests discovered in new location

image.altText: Gideon sits with arms around his legs as he wears headphones in a grand gilded room with a painting of two dancers behind him.

props.synopsis: Tom Ward was living in rural Aotearoa/New Zealand with his young family when he got the call: the creators of Gilmore Girls and The Marvelous Mrs Maisel wanted to work with him.

title.children: How Please Like Me's Tom Ward became a Hollywood writer

image.altText: A man in military type uniform and slouch hat on a horse

props.synopsis: A six-week journey on horseback through more than 30 rural towns has brought the story of the Australian Light Horse to life for students across country Australia.

title.children: History arrives on horseback for 14 students at rural NSW school
